node.title: The Mystical Smoo Cave of Scotland: A Traveler's Guide
node.summary:
This month my friend Alex Berger talks about northern Scotland and shares the story of Smoo Cave.
Smoo Cave isn’t the most grandiose cave you’ll ever explore.
In addition to Smoo Cave, Durness is also a popular base for exploring Cape Wrath.
There are several hostels and numerous hotels and B&Bs in the area; the most convenient for viewing Smoo Cave is the Durness Youth Hostel.
Smoo Cave is free to visit but the boat tour costs roughly 5 GBP and typically lasts 20-30 minutes.

node.title: How to Visit Alberto Gutiérrez, the Stone Carving Hermit of Nicaragua
node.summary:
But if you’re looking for something different and personable, travel north to Esteli and search out Alberto Gutiérrez, the town’s stone-carving hermit.
“We’ll head down there to Alberto’s house,” Rodney said to me.
If you find yourself in Nicaragua and want to see the most jovial and interesting man in the country, head up to Esteli and visit Alberto.
To visit Alberto Gutiérrez, take a bus or taxi to the Tisey Estanzuela Natural Reserve.
Roam Nicaragua also has a tour for $30 USD if you don’t want to try to find Alberto by yourself!

info.author: Kendra Granniss, Jonathan Look
